result.execSummary:
The defendant John E. Litviak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: Obey DOC's rules and regulations. Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming recommended by DOC. Pay costs.
Concurrent with: Probation in this case is concurrent with the probation in 16CM9 but consecutive to the sentence in 17CF73.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John E. Litviak in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA states details of the parties' agreement for resolution of these matters:

17CF73
Count 1/substantial battery  Def will plead GNC for prison sentence totaling 3.5 years with 1.5 years initial and 2 years ES.
Count 2/felony bail jump  Def will plead GNC for 3 years probation consecutive to Count 1.
Count 3 will be dismissed.
Count 4/misdemeanor bail jumping  Def will plead GNC for 6 months jail, consecutive to Count 1.
Count 5 will be dismissed and read in.

16CF142 will be dismissed and read in in its entirety.

16CF143 
Count 1/delivery of THC  Def will plead GNC for 3 years probation, consecutive to the sentence in 17CF73.
Rest of charges will be dismissed and read in.

16TR2003/OWI 1st  Def will plead GNC for $150 base fine for $811.50 total, 6 mo revocation, AODA/driver safety plan.

16CM9
Count 1 will be dismissed and read in.
Count 2  Def will plead GNC for 24 months probation, consecutive to 17CF73 with conditions of $300 restitution to BG and no contact with BG except as permitted by the agent.

16CM11
Count 1/damage to property  Def will plead GNC for 2 years probation, consecutive to 17CF73. No restitution requested in this case.
Remaining counts DRI.

Conditions of ES and probation:
Submit to and comply with all assessments and treatment as recommended by the agent. Pay costs.
93 days credit, to be applied to count 1 of 17CF73.

Def pleads no contest to the charges indicated in the plea agreement. Courts colloquy on pleas.
16TR2003/OWI 1st  Court sentences def as requested - $811.50 total, 6 mo rev, and AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.

Counsel address the Court regarding their joint recommendation. Def addresses the Court. 

Court states that 17CF73 is is too substantial to completely follow the joint recommendation of the parties. 
17CF73 - Court follows joint recommendation on Count 1 for 3.5 years sentence with 18 months initial confinement and 2 years ES.
Count 2 - Court sentences def to max - 6 years prison with 3 years initial confinement and 3 years ES. Concurrent with Count 1.
Count 4 - 6 months consecutive time to the time in Counts 1 and 2.

16CM9 - Count 1 - 24 months probation consecutive to the sentences in 17CF73. $300 restitution to BG. 

16CM11 - Count 1 - 2 years probation concurrent with the probation in 16CM9 but consecutive to the sentence in 17CF73.

16CF143 - Count 1 - 3 years probation consecutive to the prison sentence in 17CF73.

Conditions of probation and ES: obey rules and regs of DOC; attend, pay for, and succ. complete any programming recommended by the department. Pay one set of costs in each action.

All other counts in those cases are DRI. 16CF42 DRI entirely. 

93 days credit, to be applied to both counts 1 and 2 of 17CF73. Court finds Def eligible for all prison programming - Court will leave it to DOC to determine if he qualifies.

Any costs condition of probation.

Court provides Def with written explanation of determinate sentence.

16CF142, 16CF143, 16CM09, 16CM11, 17CF73, and 16TR2003 all called together. Defendant John E. Litviak in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper asks to setover matter for a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA asks for reset.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2017 at 09:00 am.

17CF73-Def waives prelim hearing. Waiver accepted. Bindover ordered. Court conducts arraignment. State will be bringing forward same charges in criminal complaint. Def waives formal reading, court states charges and max penalties. Def pleads NG. 
Atty Longacre requests to address bond, asks to amend signature bond. Court denies request.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 31, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Def from the jail

Defendant John E. Litviak appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant John E. Litviak. Several cases called together including adjourned initial in 17CF73. Atty. L was just appointed by the SPD office. Court completes the initial in 17CF73 - charges, penalties and rights including right to prelim stated. Defense waives the prelim time limits in 17CF73. Court schedules the prelim for 10/11 at 11. 

NG pleas formally entered this date in 16CF142. The prelim was waived back in January and the information has been filed in that matter, however, arraignment had not yet occurred until now.

Atty. L asks for modification of bond from cash to signature. DA Harper objects to modification of bond. Request is denied.

Status in all matters and prelim in 17CF73 set for 10/11 at 11.  Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Status in 16CF142, 16CF143, 16CM9, 16CM11, and initial appearance in newly-filed case 17CF73. Defendant John E. Litviak appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody and without counsel; Atty. Bartelt no longer representing; SPD to reappoint counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA asks for 10k cash bond in the new case - conditions of no contact with BG and that to apply whether/not def is released. Court orders $2500 cash with the conditions requested. This is in addition to the $2500 cash bond previous set. So, in ordered to be released, def would need to post $5000. Matters reset to 8/17 at2:30 with the hope that SPD reappoints counsel by that point.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
